00001 /********************************************************************************************************
00002 
00003 Copyright (C) 2009 Deepak Chandran
00004 
00005         This file defines a gene regulatory network using fractional saturation models for the kinetics. 
00006         The functions in this file are designed to be used with the GA library that I have written. 
00007         
00008         This file defines the following functions that are required in the GA:
00009                 1) a struct that represents an "individual"
00010                 2) a mutation function to randomly alter an individual
00011                 3) a crossover function to make a new individual from two individuals
00012         
00013         In addition, the file defines:
00014                 1) ODE function to simulate a network
00015                 2) Propensity function to simulate a network stochastically
00016         
00017         The program using this file must define:
00018                 1) a function that returns the fitness of a network
00019                 
00020 *********************************************************************************************************/
00021 
00022 #include <stdio.h>
00023 #include <stdlib.h>
00024 #include <math.h>
00025 #include "ga.h"
00026 #include "mtrand.h"
00027 #include "cvodesim.h"   //for ODE simulation
00028 #include "ssa.h"        //for stochastic simulation
00029 
00030 #ifndef GENE_REGULATORY_FOR_GA
00031 #define GENE_REGULATORY_FOR_GA
00032 
00036 typedef struct
00037 {
00038         int * TFs;
00039         int size;
00040 }
00041 complex;
00042 
00046 typedef struct
00047 {
00048         int species;  //number of genes
00049         int numComplexes; //size of each array defined in this struct
00050         
00051         complex * complexes; //a list of complexes
00052         int * targetGene; //the gene that is regulated by the complexes
00053         double * Ka; //the association constant (if negative, then it is a repressor)
00054         
00055         double * Vmax; //the Vmax for each protein
00056         double * degradation; //degradation rate for each protein
00057 } 
00058 GeneRegulationNetwork;
